form.label: ASD Essential 8 - Restrict Admin Privileges - Changes Details

html.p:
Only use administrator privileges for managing systems, installing legitimate software and applying software patches. These should be restricted to only those that need them.
Why? Admin accounts are the 'keys to the kingdom', adversaries use these accounts for full access to information and systems. This page provides an overview of privileged activities related to changes in your environment of both hosts and users.

When reviewing this dashboard, you should pay attention to number of account changes in the environment looking for increases in each of the categories. In addition, review the changes by type in the centre dashboard.

search.query: |datamodel Change_Analysis Account_Management search | search TaskCategory="*Group Management" | `drop_dm_object_name("All_Changes")` | eval src_user=mvindex(Security_ID,0) | eval dest_user=mvindex(Security_ID,1) | eval group=mvindex(Security_ID,2)| table _time,action, src_user,dest_user,group,signature | rename action as Action, src_user as "Source User", dest_user as "Destination User", group as Group, signature as "Activity Action"
| tstats count from datamodel=Change_Analysis where All_Changes.change_type=user by _time, All_Changes.user, All_Changes.action, All_Changes.dest, All_Changes.result

panel.title: Example data sources to power this dashboard

ul.li: Data that signfies change - This dashboard provides a broad view of changes in the environment. At a high level you should index any data that has an audit trail that contains a username, an action and whether the action was successful or not.
Assett Inventory Data - Microsoft Active Directory, CMDB, SCCM. These sources must log the hostnames to allow comparison to Application Whitelisting Data.
